title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: Hi ive got an 820-4924 with no backlight, board has no liquid damge, 5v on screen enable and have pic , 12v on backlight so its not boosting, its 100% working screen, at u7700 pins 17 and 18 i get 5v,, r7732 & r7731 feedback resistors measure fine also checked connection to the lcd connector and fine, changed u7700 three times just incase i had bad chips but still get no boosting, backlight fet driver resistor also measured fine and changed q7701 just out of desperation :-)  now im going round in circles and must be missing the obvious so if anyone can shed some light i would be more than greatfull

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: BKLT_EN_R present??

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: yes got 5v there

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: Diode mode on I2C_BKLT_SCL and I2C_BKLT_SDA???

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: Also try another display assambly, remember should 2015!!

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: 0.527  i2c_bklt_scl , 0.549 i2c_bklt_sda

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: checked display assy with another board and alls fine

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: diode readings are with the screen connected

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: Remove display and measure again...

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: i2c_bklt_sda 1.821 ,  i2c_bklt_scl  0.575

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: i2c_bklt_sda is to high!! R7751 value??? this could be a bad R7751, broken trace or dead U7700...

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: i2c_bklt_sda 1.821, I would say there is a bad trace or dead backlight IC.

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: ok so yes the trace is bad , ive run a wire from pin 1 r7751 to pin 2 r7753 then up to pin 2 c8358 and test point next to it, then had to go across to pin 4 of screen connector now at each point i get the same reading of 0.454 but still no boosting on the backlight, done pram reset just incase

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: No boost is something else than no backlight. What is the voltage on backlight output pin?

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: Hi Duke im getting 12.2v pin 1 of j8300

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: That is good then there is communication with the LCD/driver chip. EDP_BKLT_PSR_EN present?

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: arh did have ealier now reading 0v

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: ok ive run a wire from r8309 which has EDP_BKLT_PSR_EN down to r7742 , r7742 is reading fine but still no backlight :-(

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: Check again for EDP_BKLT_PSR_EN at U770 to make sure. Was there corrosion around U7700? Did you do a PRAM reset? Known good LCD for 2015 model?

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: yep EDP_BKLT_PSR_EN at U770 present  , as far as i can see no corrosion anywhere , did a pram reset and yes lcd works on another board

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: What is voltage now on the LCD connector? Still 12.2V? Tested LCD on another 4924 board? Check EDP_BKLT_PWM

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: yes voltage still 12.2v on lcd connector , 0v on EDP_BKLT_PWM pin 8 of lcd connector and 0v everwhere else for that signal , is it pssible to run a wire from l8300 for the 5v or am i gonna blow the board

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: So there is no PWM signal. I have to ask again if you are sure this is a 2015 LCD assembly and if it was tested on a 2015 machine.

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: yes i used another customers board to check this screen and also my test screen and both were working , unless ive managed to blow both these screens but this board has now gone so i cant recheck the screens i have, i have rechecked the board and now im getting 1.47v at EDP_BKLT_PWM pin 8 of lcd connector, still 12.2v at pin 1

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: Do a diode mode reading on LCD connector pins 1-10 without LCD connected.

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message:
without lcd connected the readings are:
pin1=0.519
pin2=ol
pin3=0.543
pin4=0.543
pin5=0.669
pin6=0.757
pin7=0.758
pin8=0.705
pin9=0.808
pin10=0.559

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: That looks ok. I have no idea besides still the LCD not being a 2015 model. What machine did you test it on?

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: its was an a1502 serial number c02qjtcefvh3 which ive just looked up again and should be 2015

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: Only suspects left would be Q7701, U7700 and D7710 then.

title: [SOLVED]820-4924 backlight headache
message: Duke thankyou for your patience you put me in the right direction with the broken trace on the i2c_bklt_sda line which if i had done as i replied back to you with what i done ie pin 4 of the lcd then i would have saved myself hours of frustration, like a prize pratt i soldered it to pin 3 of the lcd connector, this week i have learnt alot about the backlight circuit and it reminded me why this site is worth every penny, thankyou and to aprendiz too :-)
